nplcit.text: Van Esch, L. "An Experminental Investigation of Mixed-Media Advertising Effects" (York University (Canada), Proquest, UMI Dissertations Publishing, 1987, NL35771)

abstract.p: Product recommendation is disclosed, including retrieving user behavior data associated with a predetermined statistical period
sorting the user behavior data into one or more groups of data corresponding to one or more types of products based at least in part on associated product identifiers
determining a plurality of interest levels associated with the predetermined statistical period for at least one or more groups of data

determining a plurality of purchase peak probabilities using at least the plurality of interest levels, wherein a purchase peak probability is associated with a predicted likelihood of user interest in receiving recommendations associated with a type of product
ranking at least a portion of the plurality of purchase peak probabilities in response to receipt of an indication to present recommendation information
and presenting recommendation information based at least in part on the ranked at least portion of the plurality of purchase peak probabilities.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Output method, system and server of recommendation information

abstract.p: The invention discloses an output method, system and server of recommendation information. The method comprises the following steps of: extracting user action data in a predetermined statistic period from a user action database
classifying the user action data according to commodity identifications to obtain a time sequence about interestingness of each commodity in the statistic period
computing a purchase peak probability of the commodity according to the time sequence about interestingness

when receiving a command of outputting the recommendation information, sorting the purchase peak probability according to an order from high to low, and outputting the recommendation information of the commodity according to a sorting result. The method provided by the invention automatically computes the purchase peak probability of the commodity on time dimension according to the user action data, thereby improving the recommendation accuracy of a recommendation system and reducing the transmission quantity of unnecessary data in the network

since the recommendation information is automatically modified and output by a server, and the computation capability of the server is sufficiently used, the information input quantity and computation resource of the recommendation system can be reduced when the recommendation information is adjusted according to the purchase peak probability.
Product recommendation is disclosed, including retrieving user behavior data associated with a predetermined statistical period
sorting the user behavior data into one or more groups of data corresponding to one or more types of products based at least in part on associated product identifiers
determining a plurality of interest levels associated with the predetermined statistical period for at least one or more groups of data

determining a plurality of purchase peak probabilities using at least the plurality of interest levels, wherein a purchase peak probability is associated with a predicted likelihood of user interest in receiving recommendations associated with a type of product
ranking at least a portion of the plurality of purchase peak probabilities in response to receipt of an indication to present recommendation information
and presenting recommendation information based at least in part on the ranked at least portion of the plurality of purchase peak probabilities.
L'invention a trait à la recommandation de produits, qui consiste : à récupérer des données sur le comportement des utilisateurs qui sont associées à une période statistique prédéfinie

à trier les données sur le comportement des utilisateurs pour obtenir un ou plusieurs groupes de données correspondant à un ou plusieurs types de produits basés au moins en partie sur des identificateurs de produits associés
à déterminer une pluralité de niveaux d'intérêt associés à ladite période statistique prédéfinie pour un ou plusieurs groupes de données

à déterminer une pluralité de probabilités de pic d'achat, au moins grâce à la pluralité de niveaux d'intérêt, une probabilité de pic d'achat étant associée à la vraisemblance prévue attachée à l'intérêt que l'utilisateur portera à la réception de recommandations associées à un type de produit
à classer au moins une partie de la pluralité de probabilités de pic d'achat en réponse à la réception d'une indication demandant de présenter des informations de recommandation
et à présenter les informations de recommandation, au moins en partie sur la base de la partie ou des parties de la pluralité de probabilités de pic d'achat qui ont été classées.
